title: Launch day for Virgin Galactic shares: Company to list on New York stock exchange on Monday
text:
Investors will from Monday be able to buy shares in Sir Richard Branson’s ambitious project to fly passengers into space after he completed a deal to make Virgin Galactic a public company.

Virgin Galactic, heavily backed by Branson, completed a merger with a listed US investment firm last Friday and will start trading on the New York stock exchange on Monday.

As part of the merger, the company has received $570million, including $20million from aerospace giant Boeing, to help fuel its ambitions of operating commercial spaceflights from next year.

Virgin Galactic, heavily backed by Richard Branson, will start trading on the New York stock exchange on Monday

The latest cash injection values Virgin Galactic at $2.3billion. Before the merger, it had already received investment from Branson and Mubadala, the Abu Dhabi sovereign wealth fund.

Branson, who has invested around $880million, will remain the biggest shareholder, owning more than 40 per cent of the company. He plans to ring the opening bell himself.

Earlier this year Virgin flew to the edge of space with a passenger for the first time.
